articles.title: Amazon One Medical, Reperio Health partner on at-home screenings
articles.summary: Reperio Health and Amazon One Medical have partnered to link at-home preventive health screenings with ongoing primary care access. Individuals who complete Reperio’s at-home screening will receive direct access to a One Medical membership, creating a pathway from early detection to follow-up care, according to a Jan.

articles.title: The hospitals, health systems cutting jobs in 2026
articles.summary: A number of hospitals and health systems are reducing their workforces amid ongoing financial strain. Executives have cited a mix of factors — including lower reimbursement, rising labor and supply costs, and the need to realign operations — as drivers of these decisions.

articles.title: Christ Hospital embeds AI pilots into governance
articles.summary: As health systems accelerate artificial intelligence adoption, many are finding that the hardest work is not launching pilots, but deciding which ones deserve to move forward and which should stop. At Cincinnati-based Christ Hospital Health Network, leaders deliberately chose to embed AI pilots and proof-of-concept work into the system’s enterprise governance structure rather than treating […] The post Christ Hospital embeds AI pilots into governance appeared first on Becker's Hospital Review | Healthcare News & Analysis.

articles.title: Christus opens $30M Texas hospital
articles.summary: Irving, Texas-based Christus Health opened a $30 million, 30,000-square-foot hospital in Palestine, Texas, Jan. 29.

articles.title: What Rush did to plan for ICE, policy volatility
articles.summary: As federal and state policy changes accelerate, legal departments inside health systems are taking on a more operational role. At Chicago-based Rush University System for Health, that shift has intensified over the past year as political and regulatory developments increasingly influence day-to-day decisions across the organization.

articles.title: Government shutdown looms: What’s at stake for healthcare
articles.summary: A deal was struck Jan. 29 between Senate Democrats and Republicans to move five spending bills forward after a six-bill government funding package earlier that day failed to reach the 60-vote threshold for passage, The New York Times reported.

articles.title: What PeaceHealth’s CEO wants to build — and what she won’t compromise
articles.summary: As Sarah Ness steps into her role as CEO of Vancouver, Wash.-based PeaceHealth, she brings more than two decades of institutional knowledge — and a clear vision of what success looks like under her leadership.

articles.title: Newsom files a civil rights complaint against CMS’ Oz in latest feud with the Trump administration
articles.summary: California Gov. Gavin Newsom announced his office was filing a civil rights complaint with HHS accusing CMS Administrator Mehmet Oz of discrimination.

articles.title: Tenuous biomedical funding has put first-year Ph.D. students in a bind
articles.summary: First-year biomedical graduate students across the country said labs have been hesitant to take them in due to a tenuous funding environment

articles.title: How direct-to-consumer health tests could impact insurance, mortgages, and employment
articles.summary: As more consumers order up lab tests and genetic screenings, experts say it could impact insurance, loans, and employment decisions.

articles.title: Trump’s addiction initiative brings bold rhetoric but few details
articles.summary: The White House unveiled a new effort to streamline the country’s response to its drug and alcohol epidemic. But the announcement was light on details.

articles.title: Senate Democrats strike deal with White House to keep government funded: media reports
articles.summary: Legislation that includes funding for HHS and Medicare telehealth extensions is now in peril as Senate Democrats hardened their stance on Department of Homeland Security funding.

articles.title: More than 75 health systems call for stepped-up oversight of patient data sharing
articles.summary: More than 75 health systems sent a letter to federal officials raising concerns about the integrity of nationwide data sharing networks, flagging issues with "bad actors" gaining access to patients' medical information.

articles.title: KFF: Nearly 53M prior auth requests submitted in Medicare Advantage in 2024
articles.summary: A new study shows that close to 53 million prior authorization requests were sent to Medicare Advantage plans in 2024, increasing from 2023 and far above the number required in traditional Medicare.

articles.summary: Stick with this tracker for the latest layoff and workforce updates from across healthcare.

articles.title: Hims & Hers uses another Super Bowl ad to tackle healthcare affordability
articles.summary: The minute-long ad, which debuted online Thursday ahead of its broadcast premiere during the Feb. 8 game, starts with a stark claim: “Rich people live longer,” said by the ad’s narrator, the rapper and actor Common.

articles.title: About 23M have signed up for ACA coverage so far: CMS
articles.summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services has released new data on the Affordable Care Act's open enrollment period, with sign-ups lagging the same timeframe last year.

articles.title: Pennsylvania health department clears CHS' 3-hospital sale to nonprofit
articles.summary: Community Health Systems and Tenor Health Foundation signed a definitive agreement regarding the transfer of Commonwealth Health in October. A prior deal to divest the three-hospital system to another nonprofit had fallen through last year.

articles.title: 10 Medicaid vendors pledge $600M in discounted, free services to support work requirements, CMS says
articles.summary: As states gear up to implement Medicaid work requirements nationally at the start of next year, the Trump administration announced Thursday that 10 leading tech companies have promised to offer $600 million in discounted and free services to support the rollout.

articles.title: Spring Health to buy Alma as AI rapidly reshapes mental healthcare market
articles.summary: Spring Health, a company that offers digital mental healthcare and navigation services, plans to acquire Alma to expand its reach and tap into the the company's roster of health plan partners.
